result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick J. Eppolite Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Posses w/Intent-Fentanyl (>10-50) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(dm)2.
  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc.(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged complete 9 hours community service per week.

Maintain absolute sobriety and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances unless prescribed and taken as prescribed. 

No contact with victims; J.H., Culvers or Arbys without agent approval.

Assessment, treatment, counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 

AODA. 

DNA sample. 

$8,170.00 seized cash to be forfeited.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Pre-trial conference on October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

INCLUDES 22CF408, 22CF409:  No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.   Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. No possession of drug paraphernalia.   Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.    Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Case Called:1:45 pm
INCLUDES 18CF957, 20CF346, 20CF1175, 21CF128, 21CF1421, 21CF1532, 22CF87, 22CF408, 22CF409.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig in person. Defendant appears in custody, in person, and with Atty Dan Cveykus and Atty Oren Jakobson in person.
VRCW.
Court addresses the parties; Court notes that he has previously recused himself of a case from 2013 and has no recollection of the file. 
Court will not recuse on these files. 
Parties are requesting a Pretrial Conference to discuss the files. 
Atty Jakobson states that there was a Speedy Trial Demand on 22CF408 and 22CF409 previously, and Defendant has not retracted that demand. 
Atty Jakobson makes arguments regarding bond. ADA Puig makes statements. 
Court Converts Bonds to Signature Bonds; Atty Jakobson is withdrawing the Speedy Trial Demand due to the bonds being converted to a signature bond.

DATES:
Future dates to be set with the JA-
PTC, FPT, JSH, JT 

Adjourned: 1:47 pm
Review hearing on September 26, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
